definition: Pan Jinlian (name lit. Golden Lotus), heroine of Ming dynasty vernacular novel Jinpingmei or the Golden Lotus 金瓶梅
surname Pan/Pan, faun in Greek mythology, son of Hermes
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
surname Jin/surname Kim (Korean)/Jurchen Jin dynasty (1115-1234)
lotus

sentences.english: On contemporary literature, Absurd Plays "Pan Jinlian" is a must-read works.
sentences.chinese: 上當代文學，荒誕劇《潘金蓮》是必讀作品。

sentences.english: The Sichuan opera Pan Jinlian examines Pan Jinli an's degradation from different perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 川劇《潘金蓮》從不同視角中審視潘金蓮的沉淪。

sentences.english: The Sichuan opera Pan Jinlian examines Pan Jinli an's degradation from different perspectives.
sentences.chinese: 川劇《潘金蓮》從不同視角中審視潘金蓮的沉淪。

sentences.english: The same stage, there is inter-generational cross-border inter-Korean intercontinental people to note Pan Jinlian.
sentences.chinese: 同一舞臺上，有跨朝跨代跨國跨洲的人來評說潘金蓮。

sentences.english: Pan Jinlian is a controversial literary heroine.
sentences.chinese: 潘金蓮是一個有爭議的女性形象。

sentences.english: Pan Jinlian is one of the most well-known typical images in Chinese Literature.
sentences.chinese: 潘金蓮是中國知名度最高的典型形象之一。

definition: Ximen Qing, character from 金瓶梅[Jin1 ping2 mei2] and 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4]
Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705
lit. laughs, jeers, anger and invective (idiom)/fig. all kinds of emotions/to mock and scold/(of writing) freely roving/following the author's fancy
Jia Baoyu, male character in The Dream of Red Mansions, in love with his cousin Lin Daiyu 林黛玉 but obliged to marry Xue Baochai 薛寶釵|薛宝钗
stratagem/scheme
(of a woman) to dress as a man (idiom)
shameless
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
palace maid/CL:個|个[ge4],名[ming2],位[wei4]
honey trap/sexual entrapment/CL:條|条[tiao2]
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
trick/ruse/crafty scheme
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
profound mystery

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
